revised_title: Gill Morphometrics of Latimeria chalumnae: A Comparative Study
tldr: This study measures the surface area of the gill lamellae in the coelacanth, Latimeria chalumnae, and compares it to other fish species. The results show a low surface area in the coelacanth, indicating a relatively inactive lifestyle with a low consumption rate and food requirement. The study also examines the gill morphology and provides insights into the adaptation of the coelacanth to its environment.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Fish Anatomy and Physiology
